intro: Erigeron bakeri, commonly known as Baker's blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It features silvery-gray foliage and produces small blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
